010package imagingbook.common.threshold.adaptive;
011
012import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
013import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.threshold.Thresholder;
015
016/**
017 * TODO: convert to interface.
018 * @author WB
019 * @version 2022/04/02
020 */
021public abstract class AdaptiveThresholder extends Thresholder {
022        
023        public abstract ByteProcessor getThreshold(ByteProcessor bp);
024        
025        public void threshold(ByteProcessor bp, ByteProcessor Q) {
026                final int w = bp.getWidth();
027                final int h = bp.getHeight();
028                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
029                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
030                                int p = bp.get(u, v);
031                                int q = Q.get(u, v);
032                                bp.set(u, v, (p <= q) ? 0 : 255);
033                        }
034                }
035        }
036        
037        public boolean threshold(ByteProcessor ip) {
038                ByteProcessor Q = this.getThreshold(ip);
039                if (Q != null) {
040                        this.threshold(ip, Q);
041                        return true;
042                }
043                else {
044                        return false;
045                }
046        }
047        
048        // TODO: change to use an ImageAccessor!
049        protected int getPaddedPixel(ByteProcessor bp, int u, int v) {
050                final int w = bp.getWidth();
051                final int h = bp.getHeight();
052                if (u < 0)
053                        u = 0;
054                else if (u >= w)
055                        u = w - 1;
056                if (v < 0)
057                        v = 0;
058                else if (v >= h)
059                        v = h - 1;
060                return bp.get(u, v);
061        }
062        
063        // used for logging/testing only
064        protected double[] getLine(ByteProcessor bp, int v) {
065                double[] line = new double[bp.getWidth()];
066                for (int u = 0; u < line.length; u++) {
067                        line[u] = bp.get(u, v);
068                }
069                return line;
070        }
071        
072        // used for logging/testing only
073        protected double[] getLine(FloatProcessor fp, int v) {
074                double[] line = new double[fp.getWidth()];
075                for (int u = 0; u < line.length; u++) {
076                        line[u] = fp.getf(u, v);
077                }
078                return line;
079        }
080}
